LOL!! I don't know.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Sumption=
 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 2:12 PM
  Sub=
ject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config. [1 Attachment]


  [Attachment(s=
) from Frank Sumption included below] 



   At about 10 seconds "chris mak=
es riches off this"? So was that there at the time of recording or does it =
get changed?

   F-S


  On Fri, May 29, 2009 at 8:01 AM, April Abercrombie=
 <april@...> wrote:





    If you let him that i=
s.

      ----- Original Message ----- 
      From: April Abercrombie 
    =
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 8:00 AM
   =
   Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.



      I think the botto=
m line is we all know that Chris Moon is probably just trying to use you. H=
e'll suck you dry and toss you aside when he gets his fill.

        ----- =
Original Message ----- 
        From: Fransen, Debbie 
        To: EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups.com 
        Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 7:45 AM
        Subject=
: RE: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.



        Exactly my point... You d=
on't charge anything for the boxes
        and Chris Moon charges people fo=
r using it....
        If it's not perfected then Chris shouldn't charge ei=
ther......
        If he wasn't so public with it, then people like me woul=
dn't dislike him so much.

        The only people that have your boxes (th=
at the public hear about)
        are the well known paranormal groups and =
famous people.
        I am sure that you have given boxes to researchers w=
ho are not in the popular
        paranormal community ,and don't want to b=
e. Those are the ones that should
        get respect.  And of course YOU a=
re well respected by us lowly researchers. ( Kissin up , so you won't get m=
ad)

        And I am sure that you are sick of hearing about Chris Moon an=
d how
        alot of people thinks he sucks. And everyone wants a box.....=
.
        But you have to expect that. You are the only one out there that =
is honest and
        doesn't want to be famous.
        I know this is lik=
e beating a dead horse, so I will shut up now.... :)





-----------------=
-------------------------------------------------------
        From: EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Frank Sump=
tion
        Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 9:22 AM
        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.com
        Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.



         =
Keep in mind the money thing works two ways, I also don't sell/charge for t=
he boxes. Someday I will--when it's perfected!

         Frank-S


        =
On Fri, May 29, 2009 at 6:16 AM, Fransen, Debbie <debbie.fransen@...>=
 wrote:





          Of course Chris Moon speaks highly of him.
         =
 Frank has made him lots of money.



-------------------------------------=
---------------------------------
          From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [=
mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Elaine Coates
          Sent: =
Thursday, May 28, 2009 3:49 PM 

          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com

   =
       Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.




          Okay, th=
en could I have a copy of the new schematic when you get it drawn?  That wo=
uld be even better.  Where are you from?  Chris Moon speaks highly of you.
=




----------------------------------------------------------------------
=
          From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
          To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 2:29:09 PM
   =
       Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.


          Besides--I=
 didn't like that radio design, it's too complex, and the documentation is =
screwy. I did a simpler radio last night that should be better, simpler, ch=
eaper, and clearer sound. 



          On Thu, May 28, 2009 at 5:41 AM, El=
aine Coates <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com> wrote:





            The jpg for th=
is schematic is kind of blurry in places.  Is there any way a more clear co=
py could be send to me? I would be forever grateful.  Thanks Frank - Elaine=





--------------------------------------------------------------------
 =
           From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>

            T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
            Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 12:55:=
00 AM
            Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.



        =
    http://purplealieng irl.tripod. com/ 

             However, it's const=
antly changing. The radio I made tonight is very simple, and can significan=
tly simplify construction. I used to make the sweep and amplifier circuits,=
 then use a commercial radio, like the 12-469, as a tuner. 

             T=
he MK484 is follwed by a couple high impedence op amp stages to bring the a=
udio up to line levels. I haven't had time to do schematic yet. I draw the =
schematics with MS paint, and they are stored as jpeg images, which isn't t=
he best, but it makes them e-mailable. 

             Frank-S


           =
 On Wed, May 27, 2009 at 8:54 PM, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com> wr=
ote:





              Hi folks, I just joined this group.  I was recently=
 at the Lizzy Borden house in Massachusetts with Chris Moon and had a sessi=
on with Frank's Box.  The results were astounding.  Is this the newest sche=
matic for Frank's box?  If so, is there a way to get a clearer copy of it? =
 My son said he would build one for me and I have been searching for the sc=
hematic.  Can anyone help? - Elaine




-----------------------------------=
-------------------------------
              From: Frank Sumption <purplea=
liengirl@ gmail.com>

              To: evp-itc@yahoogroups .com; grassharp=
@yahoogrou ps.com 

              Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 5:45:16 PM
=
              Subject: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config. [1 Attachment]




=
               I think I followed an erroneous LM3820 layout, so I'm going =
to breadboard this layout. Note the antenna input is now on pin 12-11, this=
 is the RF amp input, and pin 13 is the RF amp output, which feeds pin 1.

=
               'case anyone cares. 

               F-S



















=
